intro: Galium sylvestre subsp. papillosum, commonly known as the hairy bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and usually have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
